intro: Ctenium sesquiflorum, commonly known as the narrowleaf ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-arid regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
